result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Markus Darnell Funches in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Markus Darnell Funches appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
Case in court for status conference. State's motion to dismiss the 9/7/22 Jury Trial heard. Defense has no objection. Court grants State's motion.
Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report, filed.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; State's Notice of Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial

State compliant with victim notification.  Defendant given copy of amended complaint.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  State does not request amendment to bail.  Defense requests adjourned status date.  Court grants request.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial September 7, 2022 at 9:00 am.
